key_mistakes.reason: Early pawn move doesn't contest the center effectively.
Weakens the d5 pawn, not developing pieces.
Misses a chance to gain control of the center.
Loses tempo and doesn't challenge Black's active pieces.
Aggressive knight move leads to material loss.
Sacrifices a knight without sufficient compensation.
Knight is vulnerable and doesn't contribute to the position.
Loses material without gaining a significant advantage.
Doesn't improve position or create threats.
Too passive, allows opponent to consolidate.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center with pawns and pieces.
Develop pieces actively and avoid unnecessary pawn moves.
Be cautious with tactical sacrifices unless they provide clear compensation.
Look for opportunities to improve piece positions and create threats.
